Header: Indian Ocean is an important location for international politics: PM
Content: The commissioning parade for the passing out of 44 midshipmen of the Sri Lanka Navy as commissioned naval officers, was held on Sunday, April 3 under the auspices of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that they it is their duty to join with the Navies of Asian nations when situations arise, especially to protect the sea route – from Maldives to the Malacca Strait. Explaining further, he noted that they should obtain new ships and air crafts as the Indian Ocean would become an important location in international politics. Sri Lanka’s geographical location, which is in the centre of the Indian Ocean for the past two to three thousand years is very important. Therefore, the Sri Lanka Navy has great responsibility…, it was pointed out.
